title: SQL Fundamentals Practice Test
description: Test your knowledge of basic SQL concepts
instructions: Each question has one correct answer
You can mark questions for review
questions: [{"id":1,"text":"Which SQL statement is used to extract data from a database?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":2,"text":"Which SQL clause is used to filter records?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1}]

title: Advanced SQL Practice Test
description: Test your knowledge of advanced SQL concepts
instructions: Each question has one correct answer
You can mark questions for review
questions: [{"id":1,"text":"Which of these is a window function in SQL?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2}]

title: Quantitative Aptitude Practice Test
description: Test your math skills for competitive exams
instructions: Each question has one correct answer
You can mark questions for review

title: SSC CGL Practice Test
description: Practice test for SSC CGL examination
instructions: Each question has one correct answer
There is no -ve marking for unattempted questions
You can also use the question numbers provided to move quickly
You can bookmark any question to visit it later
questions:
[{"id":1,"text":"Three statements are given, followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and III. Assuming the statements to be true, even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements.

Statements:
All pages are diaries.
Some diaries are books.
All books are notebooks.

Conclusions:
I. No page is a notebook.
II. All pages are notebooks.
III. All diaries being notebooks is a possibility.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":3},{"id":2,"text":"The position of how many letters will remain unchanged if all the letters in the word BINDER are arranged in English alphabetical order?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":3},{"id":3,"text":"In a certain code language,

'A + B' means 'A is the mother of B';
'A - B' means 'A is the brother of B';
'A × B' means 'A is the wife of B' and
'A ÷ B' means 'A is the father of B'.

Based on the above, how is 4 related to 2 if '4 + 3 ÷ 2 ÷ 1 - 5'?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":4,"text":"Identify the figure given in the options which when put in place of '?' will logically complete the series.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":3},{"id":5,"text":"'WISK' is related to 'DRHP' in a certain way based on the English alphabetical order. In the same way, 'LENT' is related to 'OVMG'. To which of the following is 'BANG' related, following the same logic?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":6,"text":"Two sets of numbers are given below. In each set of numbers, certain mathematical operation(s) on the first number result(s) in the second number. Similarly, certain mathematical operation(s) on the second number result(s) in the third number and so on. Which of the given options follows the same set of operations as in the given sets?

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into their constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)

18 – 36 – 72 – 107; 15 – 30 – 60 – 95","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":7,"text":"Select the number from the given options to complete the series.
25, 30, 40, 55, 75, ___","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":8,"text":"The position(s) of how many letters will remain unchanged if all the letters in the word 'ENTOMB' are arranged in English alphabetical order?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":9,"text":"Six words Eat, Cry, Play, Sleep, Run and Bath are written on different faces of a dice. Three positions of this dice are shown in the figure. Find the word on the face opposite to Eat.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":10,"text":"Two different positions of the same dice with faces T, O, B, L, Y and V are shown below. Select the letter that will be on the face opposite to the one having L.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":11,"text":"Select the word-pair that best represents a similar relationship to the one expressed in the pair of words given below. (The words must be considered as meaningful English words and must NOT be related to each other based on the number of letters/number of consonants/vowels in the word)","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":12,"text":"Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the given sets. (213, 157), (185, 129)
(NOTE : Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g., 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding /deleting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":3},{"id":13,"text":"Three of the following four options are alike in a certain way and thus form a group. Which is the one that does NOT belong to that group?
(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":14,"text":"Which of the following terms will replace the question mark (?) in the given series?
IMHP, MPJQ, QSLR, UVNS, ?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":15,"text":"In a certain code language, 'FACED' is written as 'GZDDE' and 'VACAY' is written as 'WZDZZ'. How will 'LABOR' be written in that language?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":16,"text":"Which two signs should be interchanged to make the following equation correct?
247 ÷ 13 + 16 × 3 – 148 = 119","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":17,"text":"How many triangles are there in the given figure?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":3},{"id":18,"text":"Select the correct mirror image of the given figure when the mirror is placed at MN.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":19,"text":"Select the figure from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":20,"text":"In a certain code language, 'FIVE' is written as '12184410' and FOUR is written as '12304236'. How will 'THREE' be written in that language?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":21,"text":"Select the correct mirror image of the given figure when the mirror is placed at MN as shown below.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":22,"text":"In the following series, only one letter-cluster is incorrect. Select the incorrect letter-cluster.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":23,"text":"Based on the English alphabetical order, three of the following four letter-clusters are alike in a certain way and thus form a group. Which is the one that DOES NOT belong to that group?
(Note: The odd man out is not based on the number of consonants/vowels or their position in the letter-cluster.)","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":24,"text":"Select the option that is related to the fifth number in the same way as the second number is related to the first number and the fourth number is related to the third number. 19 : 34 :: 5 : 6 :: 27 : ?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":25,"text":"What will come in the place of the question mark (?) in the following equation, if '+' and '−' are interchanged and '×' and '÷' are interchanged?
342 × 18 + 79 - 45 + 3 = ?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":26,"text":"Who among the following is the world renowned exponent of the bamboo flute?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":3},{"id":27,"text":"What is net investment?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":28,"text":"India won the ICC Men Cricket World Cup for the first time in which of the following years?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":29,"text":"Match the following institutes with their respective founders of British India.

| Month Company | May | June | July | August |
|--------------|-----|------|------|--------|
| P            | 1924 | 1780 | 1820 | 1490   |
| Q            | 1540 | 1245 | 1648 | 2450   |
| R            | 2035 | 1485 | 1350 | 1650   |
| S            | 1736 | 1855 | 1470 | 1180   |

The total number of soaps sold by companies Q and S together in May, is what percentage more than the number of soaps sold by company P in July?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":3},{"id":53,"text":"In a triangle PQR, S is a point on the side QR such that PS⊥QR, then which of the following options is true?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":54,"text":"Simplify
15.5 – [3 – (7 – (5 – (14.5 – 13.5)))]","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":55,"text":"The incomes of P, Q and R are in the ratio 10 : 12 : 9 and their expenditures are in the ratio 12 : 15 : 8. If Q saves 25% of his income, then what is the ratio of the savings of P, Q and R?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":56,"text":"The classification of 100 students based on the marks obtained by them in English and Mathematics in an examination is given in the table below. Study the table and answer the question that follows.

| MARKS OUT OF 50    |    |    |    |    |
|--------------------|----|----|----|----|
| SUBJECT            | 40 and above | 30 and above | 20 and above | 10 and above | 0 and above |
| ENGLISH            | 10 | 31 | 80 | 92 | 100 |
| MATHEMATICS        | 3 | 23 | 65 | 81 | 100 |
| AGGREGATE          | 7 | 27 | 73 | 87 | 100 |

If at least 40% marks in Mathematics are required for pursuing higher studies in Mathematics, how many students will be eligible to pursue higher studies in Mathematics?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":57,"text":"In triangles ABC and DEF, AB = FD and ∠A = ∠D. The two triangles are congruent by SAS criterion if:","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":58,"text":"Two pipes, A and B, can fill a tank in 10 minutes and 20 minutes, respectively. The pipe C can empty the tank in 30 minutes. All the three pipes are opened at a time in the beginning. However, pipe C is closed 2 minutes before the tank is filled. In what time, will the tank be full (in minutes)?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":3},{"id":59,"text":"A payment of ₹120 is made with ₹10, ₹5 and ₹2 coins. A total of 25 coins are used. Which of the following is the number of ₹10 coins used in the payment?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":60,"text":"If 28.9 : x :: x : 36.1, and x > 0, then find the value of x.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":61,"text":"Study the given pie chart carefully and answer the question that follows. The given pie chart shows the number of successful start-ups in different sectors in a particular year.

START-UPS IN THE DIFFERENT SECTORS

Agriculture 12%
Health and Pharmaceutical 30%
Infrastructure 15%
Transport 9%
Education 24%
Communication 10%

If the total number of successful start-ups is 2910, then find the number of start-ups in the education and agriculture sectors. (Neglect the decimal part.)","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":62,"text":"The height of a cylinder is 20 cm. The lateral surface area is 1760 cm². Its volume is:","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":63,"text":"Raj divides ₹1,200 in the ratio 2 : 1 : 3 among three of his friends. The amount equal to the sum of three times the largest share and two times the smallest share is:","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":3},{"id":64,"text":"A shopkeeper marked an article at ₹5,000. The shopkeeper allows successive discounts of 20%,15% and 10%. The selling price of the article is:","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":65,"text":"The average of 12 numbers is 48. The average of the first 5 numbers is 45 and the average of next 4 numbers is 52. If the 10th number is 10 less than the 11th number and is 5 more than the 12th number, then the average of the 11th and 12th numbers is:","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":66,"text":"Find the value of the following expression.
√{(1 + sin θ)/(1 - sin θ)}","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":67,"text":"The value of (sin θ - 2 sin³ θ)/(2 cos³ θ - cos θ) × (1/tan θ) = sec² θ","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":68,"text":"Let t = 2/5, then the value of the expression t³ + (3/5)³ + (9/5)t is:","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":2},{"id":69,"text":"M and N walk along a circular track. They start at 5:00 a.m. from the same point in the opposite directions. M and N walk at a speed of 5 rounds per hour and 2 rounds per hour, respectively. How many times will they cross each other before 6.30 a.m. on the same day?","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":1},{"id":70,"text":"Two circles C₁ and C₂ touch each other externally. The radius of C₁ = 16 cm and the radius of C₂ = 8 cm. Find the length (in cm) of their common tangent.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4},{"id":71,"text":"Two circles C₁ and C₂ touch each other externally. The radius of C₁ = 16 cm and the radius of C₂ = 8 cm. Find the length (in cm) of their common tangent.","type":"multiple_choice","points":1,"correctAnswer":4}]

title: SSC Special
questions:
Three statements are given, followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and III. Assuming the statements to be true, even if
they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s) from the
statements.
Statements:
All pages are diaries.
Some diaries are books.
All books are notebooks.
Conclusions:
I. No page is a notebook.
II. All pages are notebooks.
III. All diaries being notebooks is a possibility
a) Both conclusion I and II follow
b) Only conclusions I and III follow
c) Only conclusion III follows
d) Only conclusion II follows
